result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelvin L Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelvin L Bonds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT contrary to County Ordinance 63.01 to which the defendant entered a plea of guilty.  Court found the defendant guilty and ordered the defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 11-16-2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing.  Defense requests adjournment.  Case passed to allow parties to negotiate.  Case back on the record.  Case passed until 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds not in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kelvin L Bonds in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 24.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
